channel.title: Srry i ask very much but this is abouyt ubuntu 10.04 a simple question
channel.description: hi. when i install ubuntu 10.04. does my files get deleted or do they follow with ubuntu 10.04. and same about games and applications. do they kind of restore from 9.10 to 10.04 or do i have to install every singel thing from start? please answer fast :)

item.title: Srry i ask very much but this is abouyt ubuntu 10.04 a simple question
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

kneistol:

ok thx. but now i need more help. i was about to go to school and had to shut computer down. now how can i install it? because its gone from the update manager

Hehe, you shut down during an upgrade even though it specifically told you not to? Bad move, you can just fully upgrade with your package manager and hope nothing breaks I guess, good luck.

Read full topic

item.title: Srry i ask very much but this is abouyt ubuntu 10.04 a simple question
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Upgrading will make it 100% the new version, you will just keep your files you have.

@speljohan, upgrading is generally only a problem at all if you have a lot of nonstandard stuff set up. I had a problem with it because I had the latest binary drivers from the nvidia installer installed and it didn’t remove them completely, and I had KDE 3.5 installed from a ppa. Other than that it went flawlessly.

Read full topic
